H0.text: A full moon is the type of moon that shows when the Earth is between the Moon and the Sun.

H1.text: Waning moon is the type of moon that shows when the Earth is positioned between the Moon and the Sun.

H2.text: Half moon is the type of moon that shows when the earth is between the moon and the sun.

H3.text: The crescent moon is the type of moon that shows when the earth is between the moon and the sun.

A4.text: This occurs when Earth is located between the Sun and the Moon (when the ecliptic longitudes of the Sun and Moon differ by 180Â°).

A5.text: The full moon is the lunar phase when the Moon appears fully illuminated from Earth's perspective.
